newsitem.title: HONG KONG: French airport strike grounds Patten's HK pooches.
newsitem.headline: French airport strike grounds Patten's HK pooches.

text.p: Hong Kong's "first dogs", Whisky and Soda, have been stranded in the territory because of a baggage handlers' strike at Paris airport.
The pet terriers of last colonial Governor Chris Patten were due to fly to his retreat in France on Friday, as the master prepared a family exit on the territory's June 30 handover to China.
But the pair will be packed off late on Sunday instead, a spokesman at Government House said.
"Whisky and Soda were originally scheduled to leave on Friday but there was this strike in the Paris (Charles de Gaulle) airport.
"So they have been rescheduled to leave on Sunday and would arrive on Monday when they would be taken care of," he said.
Patten and family, together with heir to the throne Prince Charles, will sail out of Hong Kong shortly after midnight June 30, when 156 years of colonial rule ends.
The dogs will arrive ahead of the Pattens at their holiday home in Toulouse, France.
